intro: Justicia lilloana, commonly known as the flame violet, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are square and branching. The flowers are arranged in whorled clusters, making it a visually appealing ornamental plant.
